args:
The alliance, now led by a Dragalia-wielding
Alberius, engages in a fierce battle. Meanwhile,
Lambert secretly colludes with the Dyrenell
Emperor in an attempt to seize the power of the
Other for the Ilian Church. However, the Other
takes over his body instead and is revived.
I see the measure of your worth. Excellent.
Young human of the dragonblood,\nI acknowledge you as worthy to bear\nthe sacred sword Dragalia.
I thank you, Elysium. And with this power,\nI swear to bring down the Other and\nsafeguard people and dragons alike!
From that point forward, Alberius performed\na series of most remarkable feats.

With his strength and unyielding spirit, he saved
countless numbers—both humanoid and dragon—
and also won the hearts and minds of the masses.
In doing so, he became the icon of their hopes.
As people and dragons—beginning with the mighty\nChthonius—flocked to his side, the tides of war\nbegan to shift in favor of the alliance.
Everyone, with me and Chthonius!\nThis day, we shall achieve victory\nfor people and dragons alike!
But deep behind the scenes,\na fell plot was beginning to unfold...

The enemy forces are now led by a hero
wielding the sacred sword, and they have
gained considerable momentum since
this ＂Alberius＂ character first appeared.

Yet they do not realize this sword is a
symbol of the dragons' dominion—the
same ones who stripped the blessing of
mana from both Ilia and all humans!
It is piteous indeed to caper gleefully\nabout one's own ignorance and deception.\nDo you not agree?
...All is as you say, Your Grace.
Though by sacred decree of the Curia I am\nbound to lead the Ilian Church's alliance,\nmy heart is ever with you.
In the name of the Other, Morsayati,\nwe must secure victory and save our race\nfrom the vile hegemony of the dragons.
Indeed, this is a holy war carried out on\nthe basis of unquestionable truth—and yet,\nthe present situation poses challenges.

Our clandestine conversations have thus
far enabled us to avoid major battles,
but stopping this hero's momentum
will not come without cost.
Nothing worthwhile ever does, Your Grace.\nBut no matter the price to be paid,\nwe WILL turn the tide of this war.
Ah, I see. Have you some manner of plan?
...THAT'S what the Empire is plotting?!\nThey seek to bring back the Other?!
So claims the scout who was\ndispatched by my father.

With the Other sealed away by Ilia,
the Empire has to this point wielded
no more than a fraction of his power,
all of it drawn from the otherworld.
And even that's been a significant threat;\nwe'd be in serious trouble if they draw him\nout entirely.
This is why my father makes ready for\nbattle—and also why he wishes you\nto command the main force.
Me? All right, I'll do it. I can't stand by and\nlet them bring back the Other, after all.
Thank you. You're the only one\nI can count on right now.
(But if they actually can restore the Other,\nwhy did they not do so in the past?\nWhy do they only take this path now?)

(It is said that Ilia's knowledge as an
alchemist has been left behind among 
the secrets of the Ilian Church, but...
No. It couldn't be.)

On the day of the troop deployment, Alberius leads
a massive force in an attempt to stop the Other's
restoration. With their purpose clear, they begin a
march to the southern plains where the ritual is
purported to be held.
I hear the main force's march proceeds\napace. This is excellent news; we shall\nprepare to move out on this end.
I thought there was something unusual\nabout the Empire's activities, so I did\nsome investigating.

The southern plains where they are said
to be carrying out the Other's revival is not
suitable land for such a ceremony in terms
of terrain and bearings.
However, the base of the mountains north\nof here would be a perfect location.
Father, why are you leading a detachment\nthis time and not the main force?
And why is the detachment not following\nthe main force, but instead moving north?
As a cardinal, I must eliminate those who\nwould show contempt for Ilia's authority.
And right now, the greatest contempt\nlies with the Dyrenell Empire and\nthe Other.
Which is precisely why we will achieve\nvictory over the Empire and regain Ilia's\nauthority, yes?

Merely winning would not be enough.
The people would not forget that
worshipers of the Other successfully
threatened the Church.
Sooner or later, another Dyrenell will\nrise up, and then another.

Even so, our purpose must be to defeat
THIS threat in the here and now. We must
ensure Dyrenell is defeated and prevent
the restoration of the Other.
Ah, but Dyrenell's defeat and preventing\nthe return of the Other are entirely\ndifferent problems.
The Other is power, and great power must\nbe consolidated under a great authority—\nmuch as we have done with Alberius.
Remember well this lesson, Myriam:\nA religion is not an institution merely\nfor the expression of an ideal.
It is an organization—one with a duty\nto guide and lead the people.
Why, Father? Why are you doing this...?
Strange. Our instructions for this operation\nstated the enemy was in this area, yet it\nappears to be utterly deserted.
Perhaps this operation was based on\nincorrect information. Or perhaps...
Mym?! What's wrong?! You're supposed\nto be on standby at the cathedral.
*pant* *pant* There isn't time!\nYou have to stop my father!
Thank you for your patience, Your Grace.\nOur preparations are finally complete.
At long last, the day has come...
The day when the great Morsayati shall\nfinally be freed from his long exile!
I beseech you now, O Morsayati!\nHeed my call!
Ah, my lord... If this be your form,\nthen please grant unto me your power!
No. It is not for you.
You have my utmost gratitude, Your Grace.\nThanks to you, the space between worlds\nhas been opened.
Why, Lambert...? We were comrades\ngathered under the banner of truth...
You are the truest of believers, My Grace,\nand once you view a man as comrade,\nhe instantly has your complete trust.
Alas, this makes you most unsuited to rule.\nIn truth, you were always destined to end\nwith a knife buried in your chest like this.
You...you wretch... Faith and truth\ngo ever with Lord Morsayati...
Truth is unnecessary. Religious authority\nis all the masses need.
And to that end, I speak now to you, Other!\nI would wield your power!
Ah, so THIS is the power of the Other!\nA terrible force not of this world...\nBut it is within my means to contain it!

Your power is now mine—and with your
threat to the Ilian religion dispatched,
I shall use it to become a pillar of support
for all the people. I shall...
What is this negative energy\nwelling up inside me?!
Anger! Hatred! Are THESE the sources\nof the Other's power?!
Fight, Cardinal Lambert! Retain your self\nand return the Other's power back to the\notherworld from whence it came!
No, Alberius! We control this power now!
All is now the Ilian Church's...\nGRAAAAAAAGH!
Still do humans and dragons continue\nto strut about the world's stage.
The time has come for my fury and hate\nto spill out across this world!
The mana in the skies is decaying...
Returned from his long exile, the Other's\nspirit now resides in that man's flesh.
Father... The Other... Morsayati...\nI have obtained a vessel once more!
I see Dyrenell...as well as the hero of the\nsacred sword, possessor of dragonblood.
How does the thing know about us?
Likely he is reading the memories of the\nman whose body he now claims.
Ah, yes. The ＂hero.＂ You are naught but\na pathetic puppet gibbering upon strings\nof deception held by the Holywyrm!
Know your imprudence and despair of it.
At this rate, our forces face ruination.
You have danced with Elysium enough.\nNow let me see you dance with my fiends!
I shall make my triumphant return to the\nDyrenell Empire as its ultimate ruler.
My FATHER is going to be\nthe Dyrenell Emperor?!
That is no longer your father, Myriam.\nHe is the Other. He is Morsayati.

Now struggle with all of your might,
that when you die they pen comedies and 
sing songs of the laughable hero who was
hoodwinked by his beloved dragons.
Damnation! The more we cut down,\nthe more seem to spring from the earth!
We are at a disadvantage, Alberius.\nWe must take our forces and withdraw.
He will escape regardless. Continuing\nthis fight will only serve to send our troops\nto an early and meaningless grave.
Damn it, you're right... Retreat!\nAll troops, retreat! I have the rearguard!
(I couldn't stop the Other's return,\nbut this fight is not over yet...)
Humans once sealed away the Other,\nand now they orchestrate his return.\nTruly, they are fools.
